intro: Racosperma deficiens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, linear leaflets, and its flowers are typically yellow or pale green. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry landscapes. Racosperma deficiens plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for native wildlife.
